intro: Rittera triphylla, commonly known as the three-leafed rittera, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Rittera triphylla is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
